description: Visit a library or bookstore and explore a collection of children’s books.
Pick up 5 different flavors of Ben & Jerry’s and enjoy an ice cream tasting party while binge-watching a few episodes of The Crown.
Volunteer at an animal shelter, charity shop, food bank, local park or a museum.

Visit the zoo and challenge yourself to capture unique and unexpected perspectives in your photos. Try zooming in on just a lion's mane, or focusing on the textures of a gorilla's knuckles. Don't miss a chance to capture the curve of a flamingo's neck or the playful splash of a penguin diving into water.
Write out a list of 10 things you are grateful for – big and small. If you'd like an extra challenge set a timer and see how many things you can write down. Can you think of 200 things?
Go for a swim - if you're feeling brave how about some wild swimming?
Take a break and watch or listen to a comedy special that makes you laugh out loud. Whether it’s a stand-up performance by a well-loved comedian, a witty panel show, or a classic sketch series.

Get a large piece of paper or card and create a family tree. If your own family doesn’t inspire you, invent a new one or use a beloved fictional family instead. Let your imagination run wild as you bring the branches of your tree to life!
Clear out the clutter by filling four large rubbish bags—two for donation items and two for rubbish—all while blasting some energising music to keep you motivated and in the zone!
Explore your local area by visiting a variety of shops you’ve never been to before. You might discover hidden gems, unique items, or simply enjoy the adventure of trying something new!
